questions: If an app is frozen, what is a common first fix?
answers: Close it and reopen it, or use Task Manager/Force Quit.

questions: If an app won’t open after an update, what is a good next step?
answers: Restart the device to clear temporary issues and reload services.

questions: If a program crashes repeatedly, what is a likely fix?
answers: Update or reinstall the program to replace damaged files.

questions: If a program is slow, what system check helps?
answers: Check CPU/RAM/storage usage to see if resources are maxed out.

questions: If you see “low disk space,” what is a function-based fix?
answers: Delete unnecessary files or uninstall apps to free storage.

questions: If a program can’t save files, what is a common cause?
answers: No permission to the folder or the drive is full or read-only.

questions: If a website won’t load in one browser, what is a good test?
answers: Try another browser or private/incognito mode to compare.

questions: If audio works in one app but not another, what should you check?
answers: That the app’s volume and output device settings are correct.

questions: If an app can’t connect to the internet but others can, what’s a likely cause?
answers: The app may be blocked by firewall settings or needs permission/network access.

questions: If you get a “file type not supported” message, what should you do?
answers: Install or choose a compatible application for that file type.

questions: If text looks strange or unreadable in an app, what could fix it?
answers: Reset the app’s display settings or update fonts/graphics driver.

questions: If an app shows missing DLL/components, what is a likely fix?
answers: Repair/reinstall the app or required runtime components.

questions: If software behaves differently after a settings change, what is a quick fix?
answers: Restore default settings or undo the recent change.

questions: If an application won’t install, what is a basic requirement check?
answers: Verify OS version, available storage, and required permissions.

questions: If printing from one program fails but not others, what should you check?
answers: That the correct printer is selected inside that program.

questions: If an app shows constant pop-ups/ads, what might be happening?
answers: You may have adware or unwanted browser extensions installed.

questions: If you forget a program password, what is a safe approach?
answers: Use the official password reset method instead of guessing endlessly.

questions: If an app’s camera/mic won’t work, what should you check?
answers: OS privacy permissions for camera/microphone access.

questions: If a program won’t update, what is a good step?
answers: Check internet connection and available storage, then try again.

questions: What is a clean reinstall used for?
answers: To remove corrupted settings/files by uninstalling and installing fresh.
